intro: Galphimia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with compound leaves and sturdy stems. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a notable species in tropical and subtropical regions.
